## News Review for nanonets

# Nanonets Business Review

## Executive Summary

Nanonets gained market recognition by being included in a comprehensive market analysis of low-code/no-code AI tools, specifically positioned for AI-powered document processing and analytics capabilities according to a TechTarget report (https://www.techtarget.com/searchenterpriseai/tip/Low-code-no-code-tools-simplify-AI-customization-for-engineers). The company was listed among 25+ LCNC AI tools in a market research compilation that highlighted the growing accessibility of AI development platforms, placing Nanonets within a market segment projected to reach nearly $25 billion by 2029 with 38% annual growth. This market inclusion represents validation of the company's approach to making document processing automation accessible to users with minimal coding expertise, though it constitutes basic market recognition rather than a major business development announcement.

## Key Developments

- **Market Recognition**: Nanonets was featured in a TechTarget market roundup of notable low-code/no-code AI tools, categorized specifically for document processing and analytics applications
- **Competitive Positioning**: The company was positioned alongside established players in the LCNC AI space, indicating market acknowledgment of its document processing capabilities

## Market Context

The inclusion comes as the low-code/no-code AI platform market experiences rapid expansion, with projections indicating 38% annual growth from 2024 to 2029. Nanonets operates within the document processing segment of this broader market, which benefits from increasing enterprise demand for accessible AI tools that reduce technical barriers to implementation. The market analysis suggests growing opportunities for specialized document processing automation solutions as organizations seek to democratize AI capabilities across their operations without requiring extensive coding expertise.

## Strategic Implications

The market recognition positions Nanonets as a recognized player in the specialized document processing segment of the LCNC AI market, differentiating it from general-purpose AI development platforms. This positioning could benefit the company as enterprises increasingly seek accessible solutions for document automation tasks. However, the inclusion also highlights the competitive landscape, with Nanonets competing alongside major technology providers offering similar low-code AI capabilities. The market validation supports the company's strategic focus on making AI-powered document processing accessible to non-technical users, aligning with broader industry trends toward democratized AI tools.

### Article 1: Low-code/no-code tools simplify AI customization for engineers

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.techtarget.com/searchenterpriseai/tip/Low-code-no-code-tools-simplify-AI-customization-for-engineers)

## Summary

Nanonets received market recognition by being listed among notable low-code/no-code AI tools, specifically for AI-powered document processing and analytics capabilities. The company is positioned within a rapidly growing market segment projected to reach nearly $25 billion by 2029 with 38% annual growth, competing alongside established players like Google AutoML, Amazon SageMaker, and Microsoft Lobe. While the mention provides market validation for Nanonets' approach to accessible AI-powered document processing, it represents basic market recognition rather than a major business development.
